extraction_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

AT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: HCCP patients with Child-Pugh stage A and BC or BLC, with remote tumor measurements or localization that cannot be re-regionised or resected
HCCP patients with Child-Pugh stage A and BC or BLC, with remote tumor measurements or localization that cannot be re-regionised or resected
Patients with contraindications for A+B and D+T
PICOs.Comparator: one of the two tyrosine kinase biliary carcinomas

PICOs.Population: individual Child Pugh Stage B HCC patients (up to 8 points), with long-term metastasis or tumour localization that is not locally monitored or resectable, and an ECOG status of 0 - 1

DK.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma with preserved hepatic function and in good general condition where resection, transplantation, ablation or TACE/SIRT cannot be performed or are not expected to have an effect, or for patients with additional hepatic disease

ES.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: advanced disease, systemic treatment should be offered to patients with ECOG/PS 0-1 and Child–Pugh class A

EU.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

FR.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with compensated cirrhosis (Child-Pugh score A), in good general condition (PS 0-2), and advanced HCC (BCLC C or B not eligible for TACE)
patients with compensated cirrhosis (Child-Pugh score A), in good general condition (PS 0-2), and advanced HCC (BCLC C or B not eligible for TACE)
patients with advanced HCC previously treated with sorafenib
patients with advanced HCC previously treated with sorafenib
patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma and increased alpha-fetoprotein concentrations (AFP > 400 ng/mL) after sorafenib
patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma previously treated with sorafenib
patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma with portal vein thrombosis, in good PS, Child-Pugh A and ineligible (or after failure) to sorafenib

IT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced HCC who have failed or are not eligible for local-regional therapy, with impaired hepatic function (Child-Pugh B)
patients with advanced HCC and Child-Pugh B liver cirrhosis
patients with advanced HCC and Child-Pugh C liver cirrhosis
patients with advanced stage of HCC
patients with advanced stage of HCC
patients with advanced HCC, not eligible for any loco-regional treatment (either at diagnosis or after failure of any previous treatments), with good liver function (Child-Pugh)

NL.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with (locally) advanced hepatocellular carcinoma, where no resection, ablation or TACE is possible

PO.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with non-surgical hepatocellular carcinoma in good general condition and with good liver function (Child and Pugha Class A)

SE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma
